title: Comprehensive Cancer Information
description: Accurate, up-to-date, comprehensive cancer information from the U.S. government's principal agency for cancer research.
cleaned_text: Improving the lives of all people through cancer research People Affected by Cancer NCI is the nation's trusted source for cancer information. We are here for you with information about causes and risk factors, symptoms, how cancer is diagnosed, and treatment options. Researchers Support for the best science underpins everything NCI does. Explore our resources to help researchers conduct their work and apply for funding and training opportunities. Featured News and Research - Protecting the Heart during Chemotherapy for Lymphoma In a recent study, taking a statin reduced the risk of cardiac changes linked to heart failure. - Is HPV Testing Needed in Those Over Age 65? For some, study suggests getting the test may help prevent cervical cancer. - Drug Rewires Cancer Cells to Self-Destruct A new type of drug affects genes that control whether cells live or die. Emergency Resources Resources for patients and health care providers to continue cancer care, and information for NCI grantees and staff. [Learn More](/contact/emergency-preparedness) Are You Ready to Contribute to Progress Against Cancer? Everyone has a role to play in the fight against cancer. Learn more and get involved. [Learn More](https://nationalcancerplan.cancer.gov/) Contact Us for Help NCI offers free information on cancer topics in English and Spanish. Get live help at 1-800-4-CANCER. [Learn More](/contact) The Power of Improved Data Sharing - Childhood Cancer Data Initiative Our Organization - Senior Leaders Information about NCI Director Monica M. Bertagnolli, M.D., and other senior NCI leaders. - NCI Divisions, Offices, and Centers NCI has 30 divisions, offices, and centers who work together to build, maintain, and enhance a cohesive and comprehensive cancer research agenda. - Advisory Boards and Review Groups NCI relies on advisory committees to provide advice on the National Cancer Program, NCI scientific priorities, and more.
